posts.post_content:
Mutavault gains all types, not all colors. It remains colorless unless another card gives it a color.
  
   
Types and colors are not the same thing.
posts.html:
Mutavault gains all types, not all colors. It remains colorless unless another card gives it a color.

Types and colors are not the same thing.

Posted By: swordoath (10/9/2009 12:07:12 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm almost sure that the answer is no, the Blademaster's ability will not trigger because an ally isn't coming into play. the Mutavault becomes an ally (among other things) but since it was already in play, the ability is not triggered. HOWEVER, any ally ability that counts the number of allies in play can be helped by using mutavault's ability.
posts.html:

HOWEVER, any ally ability that counts the number of allies in play can be helped by using mutavault's ability.

posts.post_content:
The fact is, Mutavault doesn't need the tribal synergies to be good; **IT'S A MANLAND!**  
  
That being the case, not coming into play tapped, and the dozens of practical tribal applications turned what would have already been a great card had it become a typeless manland, into an amazing card.
posts.html:
The fact is, Mutavault doesn't need the tribal synergies to be good; IT'S A MANLAND!

That being the case, not coming into play tapped, and the dozens of practical tribal applications turned what would have already been a great card had it become a typeless manland, into an amazing card.
